files.patch:
@@ -104,1 +104,8 @@ - * @return the name of the algorithm, or null if not specified + * @implSpec If this object is created with {@link #EncodedKeySpec(byte[], String)}, + * the specified algorithm name is returned. + *

+ * If this object is created with {@link #EncodedKeySpec(byte[])}, this method in + * this base class returns {@code null}. A child class may parse the content of the encoded + * key and return its algorithm name if it can be determined. + * + * @return the name of the algorithm, or {@code null} if not available

@@ -2,1 +2,1 @@ - * Copyright (c) 1997, 2017, Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved. + * Copyright (c) 1997, 2022, Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved. @@ -66,0 +66,10 @@ + *

+ * This constructor parses the encoded key and tries to determine the + * algorithm name from its `privateKeyAlgorithm` field. If the name is one of the + * standard algorithm names in the {@code KeyFactory} section in the + * + * Java Security Standard Algorithm Names Specification, + * it will be returned. Otherwise, the object identifier inside the `privateKeyAlgorithm` + * field is returned in its string format as a series of nonnegative + * integers separated by periods (For example, "1.3.14.7.2.1.1"). + * If the encoded key cannot be parsed correctly, the algorithm is {@code null}.

@@ -2,1 +2,1 @@ - * Copyright (c) 1997, 2017, Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved. + * Copyright (c) 1997, 2022, Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved. @@ -56,0 +56,10 @@ + *

+ * This constructor parses the encoded key and tries to determine the + * algorithm name from its `algorithm` field. If the name is one of the + * standard algorithm names in the {@code KeyFactory} section in the + * + * Java Security Standard Algorithm Names Specification, + * it will be returned. Otherwise, the object identifier inside the `algorithm` + * field is returned in its string format as a series of nonnegative + * integers separated by periods (For example, "1.3.14.7.2.1.1"). + * If the encoded key cannot be parsed correctly, the algorithm is {@code null}.
